t: I*pn call to you, Lord,*s come quickly to me; hear*ld me when I call to you.
May*ln my prayer be set before you like incense; may*ld the lifting up of my hands be like the evening sacrifice.
Set*pn a guard over my mouth, Lord;*s keep*ld watch over the door of my lips.
Do*ln not let my heart be drawn to what is evil so*ld that I take part in wicked deeds along*ln with those who are evildoers; do*ld not let me eat their delicacies.
Let*pn a righteous man strike me—that is a kindness; let*ld him rebuke me—that is oil on my head. My*ln head will not refuse it, for*ld my prayer will still be against the deeds of evildoers.
Their*pn rulers will be thrown down from the cliffs, and*ld the wicked will learn that my words were well spoken.
They*ln will say, “As one plows and breaks up the earth, so*ld our bones have been scattered at the mouth of the grave.”
But*pn my eyes are fixed on you, Sovereign Lord;*s in*ld you I take refuge—do not give me over to death.
Keep*ln me safe from the traps set by evildoers, from*ld the snares they have laid for me.
Let*ln the wicked fall into their own nets, while*ld I pass by in safety.
